main event: A UFO was observed near Fort Collins, Colorado on September 7th, 1956. The object was described as the size of a baseball, with red and green colors, moving rapidly and leveling from north to west. It was observed for 60 seconds, ruling out an astronomical interpretation.
interesting points: The UFO was classified as a Ground-Radar and Air-Visual observation, with the source being military personnel.
The object's movement was attributed to visual interpretation rather than actual motion.
The witness described the object's color as red and green, and its size as that of a baseball.
The observation lasted for 60 seconds, ruling out an astronomical interpretation.
The report suggests that the cause of the sighting was not determined, prompting a fuller investigation.
sighted object: a UFO described as the size of a baseball, with red and green colors
